Unfotunatly I am not sure how easy it is to get gtk and guile 
working on n=
ew machines/platforms and I'm also interested in others' 
experiences with =
this.  Unfortunately some things do get out of 
date, but it is also true t=
hat the rtNEAT distribution includes all 
the original NEAT functionality p=
lus more (including Hebbian 
learning and FS-NEAT capability).  So really y=
ou get everything you 
need with rtNEAT except Guile and some visualization=
s.

Guile is not necessary to run experiments so I don't think it's too 
mu=
ch of a loss, but the gtk is used for both network and species 
visualizati=
ons, so those unfortunately aren't available without it.  
But there are ot=
her network visualizers, and you could e.g. convert 
a NEAT genome file int=
o the XML convention used in one of those, 
like SharpNEAT or NEVT, the neu=
roevolution visualization toolkit
(http://nevt.sourceforge.net/http://nevt.=
sourceforge.net/).

ken
